byline.contributor: Amy Chozick reported from Columbia, S.C., and Patrick Healy from New York. Yamiche Alcindor contributed reporting from Columbia, S.C.; Chris Dixon from Orangeburg, S.C.; and Megan Thee-Brenan from New York.
byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and PATRICK HEALY

abstract: Hillary Clinton wins her first resounding victory of 2016 primaries in South Carolina, capturing 74 percent of vote and delivering stinging defeat to Bernie Sanders; Clinton's victory rests on support of black voters, who favored her by more than six to one over Sanders; win marks turning point for Clinton and confirms her broad appeal.
lead_paragraph: Drawing overwhelming support from African-American voters, Mrs. Clinton won her first resounding victory of the 2016 campaign.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Wins South Carolina Primary
headline.print_headline: South Carolina Powers Clinton to Huge Victory

snippet: Drawing overwhelming support from African-American voters, Mrs. Clinton won her first resounding victory of the 2016 campaign.
